meanings.definition: An ornamental garden with paths between the beds of plants.
meanings.sent1: The parterre in the park had colorful flowers and neatly trimmed bushes.
meanings.sent2: Visitors strolled through the parterre admiring the different plant varieties.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel hid nuts in the parterre, thinking it was a secret garden.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a parterre of ideas, each one carefully cultivated and nurtured.
meanings.sent5: The fragrance of the roses in the parterre enveloped the entire garden.

meanings.definition: The rear section of the main floor of a theater, especially the ground floor.
meanings.sent1: The actors gathered in the parterre before the play started.
meanings.sent2: The audience in the parterre had a clear view of the stage.
meanings.sent3: During the intermission, the parterre turned into a bustling social hub.
meanings.sent4: The parterre of the theater was like a hidden gem, offering the best seats in the house.
meanings.sent5: The excitement in the parterre was palpable as the curtains rose for the performance.
